assessments.task_description:
The quiz has 4 randomly selected questions; each quiz runs for 10 minutes. You have one attempt only and must be completed in a single sitting. Question format includes:

  • multiple choice
  • true/false
  • match question/answer
  • ordering 
  • fill in the blank
  • short essay

Quizzes can be accessed through Blackboard and are held approximately every week. You can start the quiz anytime during the period given. Although it is advisable that you do not leave it to the last minute in case of Blackboard outages. 

Structure of quizzes

  • Once you start the quiz, you have 10 minutes to complete it.
  • If you don't complete it within ten minutes, the quiz will automatically submit the answers you have completed.
  • The quiz is randomized; there are 4 questions selected from a pool of questions.
  • Feedback on your answers will be withheld until every student has submitted and reviewed in the tutorials.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Each quiz will take 10 minutes and must be taken in a single sitting.

assessments.task_description:
Assessment 2 requires students to write a report, where they design a diffusion MRI protocol(s) to identify a disease or a problem of their on interest, provide peer feedback and give an oral presentation with Q and A. The overall assessment will be worth 34% of your total mark.

Students will commence online searches and choose their topic of interest from 09/03/2026 (week 3, or earlier) using UQ Library Search or PubMed (https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov)

There are three components to this report:

(1) Report submission, due on Thursday 1 pm, 16/04/26 (Week 7), this component is 15%.

The report must be in a final form and will be given to another student taking the course to review.

(2) Giving feedback to your peer using Turnitin, due on Thursday 1 pm, 23/04/26 (Week 8), this component is 4%. 

Each student will assess another student's work and provide feedback. The feedback will include an assessment of whether the report contains sufficient information, and how it can be improved.

(3) Presentation and Q&A (Week 9), this component is 15%. The specific date and time for the presentation will be sent out in Week 8 after peer-pairing has been determined and will be scheduled during Week 9. Students will be asked to make a 5 mins presentation, followed by 5 mins discussion.

Students may make changes to the final report after peer review. The due date for final submission (optional) at Turnitin is Thursday 1 pm, 30/04/2026.
